message.content:
cs.DM, cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.LG, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with problems related to directed graphs and their ordering, which are commonly studied in the areas of discrete mathematics (cs.DM) and data structures (cs.DS). The use of LP relaxations and approximation algorithms suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the fields of computational geometry (cs.CG) and theoretical computer science (cs.CC). Finally, the paper's focus on optimization and approximation makes it a potential fit for the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG), which often involves similar techniques.
